Film production companies based in Chennai

contentMetadata.content:
{{short description|Indian film company}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2020}} {{Use Indian English|date=July 2020}} {{Infobox company | name = Media Dreams | image = | logo = | type = [[Film producer|Film production]]
[[Film distribution]] | genre = | foundation = 1997 | founder = | location_city = [[Chennai]] | location_country = India | location = | locations = | area_served = | key_people = [[Sujatha (writer)|Sujatha]] | industry = [[Entertainment industry|Entertainment]] | products = [[Motion picture]]s
([[Tamil language|Tamil]]) | services = | market cap = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | assets = | equity = | owner = [[Pentamedia Graphics]] | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = | footnotes = | intl = }} '''Media Dreams''' was an Indian [[film producer|film production]] and [[film distributor|distribution]] company formed in 1997. It produced several Tamil language films in the early 2000s, and was later acquired by [[Pentamedia Graphics]].{{cite web|url=http://media-dreams.com/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20020525134303/http://media-dreams.com/|url-status=dead|archive-date=2002-05-25|title=Media Dreams Ltd. – Fullfilling your Entertainment Dreams....|accessdate=2019-09-18}} == History == Media Dreams was set up in 1997 as an Indian entertainment business unit catering to the television, theatre and the internet. It was acquired by [[Pentamedia Graphics]] in December 2000.{{cite web|url=https://www.rediff.com/money/2000/dec/26risc.htm|title=rediff.com: Money – RISC Corporate Announcements|website=rediff.com|accessdate=2019-09-18}}{{cite web|url=https://www.rediff.com/money/2004/aug/16maya.htm|website=rediff.com|title=Mayajaal shares may be listed soon|accessdate=2019-09-18}}{{cite web|url=http://www.oocities.org/sujathapage/english/enews.html|website=oocities.org|title=sujathapage/english/enews|accessdate=2019-09-18}} The group's key partners included prominent writer [[Sujatha (writer)|Sujatha]] as its managing director.{{cite web|url=https://www.mudhra.org/monthly-2001.html|title=Mudhra Monthly Programmes – 2001|website=Mudhra|accessdate=2019-09-18}} The studio's first feature film ''[[Bharathi (2000 film)|Bharathi]]'', a biopic of poet [[Subramania Bharati]], opened to critical and commercial acclaim, prompting the producers to take on several more projects in the early 2000s.{{cite web|url=https://www.sify.com/movies/bharathi-review-tamil-pcluaKbagdjjd.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220225071400/https://www.sify.com/movies/bharathi-review-tamil-pcluaKbagdjjd.html|url-status=dead|archive-date=25 February 2022|website=[[Sify]]|title=Review : (2001)|accessdate=2019-09-18}}{{cite web|url=http://www.geocities.ws/gokima/may2001.html|website=geocities.ws|title=Gokul's Tamil Cinema News|accessdate=2019-09-18}} Other notable films that the group made during the period included [[Cheran (director)|Cheran]]'s family drama ''[[Pandavar Bhoomi]]'' (2001), [[Singeetam Srinivasa Rao]]'s multilingual fantasy film ''[[Little John (film)|Little John]]'' (2001) and [[Moulee]]'s comedy drama ''[[Pammal K. Sambandam]]'' (2002) starring [[Kamal Haasan]].{{cite web|url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/2001/apr/07kamal.htm|website=rediff.com|title=rediff.com, Movies: Showbuzz! Kamal fighting fit!|accessdate=2019-09-18}}{{cite web|url=https://m.rediff.com/movies/2000/sep/02eng.htm|website=m.rediff.com|title=rediff.com, Movies: Showbuzz! Jyotika stars in English movie|accessdate=2019-09-18}}{{cite web|url=http://movies.bizhat.com/review_pandavar_bhoomi.php|author=HostOnNet.com|title=BizHat.com – Pandavar Bhoomi Review. Arunkumar, Shamitha, Rajkiran, Ranjith, Manorama|website=movies.bizhat.com|accessdate=2019-09-18}}{{cite web|url=https://www.rediff.com/entertai/2000/aug/04ss.htm|website=rediff.com|title=rediff.com, Movies: No kiss for this miss|accessdate=2019-09-18}} The group also subsequently moved onto distribute films, make television serials such as [[Balu Mahendra]]'s ''Kadhai Neram'', and release audio albums.{{cite news|url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/2000/sep/16tt.htm|website=rediff.com|title=KBC in Tamil!|date=16 September 2000|accessdate=14 July 2020}} In early 2001, Media Dreams announced that they would produce ''[[Enthiran|Robo]]'', a science fiction film by [[S. Shankar|Shankar]], starring [[Kamal Haasan]] and [[Preity Zinta]]. However, the film was later stalled due to escalating costs.{{cite web|url=http://cinematoday2.itgo.com/Tamil%20Movie%20News23.htm|website=cinematoday2.itgo.com|title=Kadal Pookal for Tamil new years day  Bharathiraja|accessdate=2019-09-18}} The team had also announced that they would produce the film version of [[Sundara Ramaswamy]]'s novel ''Oru Puliyamarathin Kathai'', which would mark the directorial debut of art director [[P. Krishnamoorthy]], but the project eventually did not materialise.{{cite web|url=https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/hamsa-geethe-bharathi-meet-krishnamoorthy-designer-behind-iconic-film-sets-76854|title='Hamsa Geethe' to 'Bharathi': Meet Krishnamoorthy, the designer behind iconic film sets|website=The News Minute|date=22 February 2018 |accessdate=2019-09-18}} The commercial failure of some of its films forced the group to stop making films, with its final release ''[[Whistle (2003 film)|Whistle]]'' (2003), having a delayed release.{{cite web|url=http://cinematoday2.itgo.com/h_com%20-%2016052001.htm|website=cinematoday2.itgo.com|title=Chinna|accessdate=2019-09-18}} == Filmography == ;Films as producer {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" style="width: 82%; text-align: center;" |- ! scope="col" | Title ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" | Language ! scope="col" | Director ! scope="col" | Cast ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Synopsis ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{tooltip|Ref.|References}} |- ! scope="row" |''[[Bharathi (2000 film)|Bharathi]]'' | 2000 | Tamil | [[Gnana Rajasekaran]] | [[Sayaji Shinde]], [[Devayani (actress)|Devayani]], [[Nizhalgal Ravi]] |The film is a biography of renowned Tamil poet Subramaniya Bharathi. | {{cite web|url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/2000/sep/26bhar.htm|website=rediff.com|title=rediff.com, Movies: The Rediff Review: Tamil film Bharati|accessdate=2019-09-18}} |- ! scope="row" |''[[Nila Kaalam]]'' | 2001 | Tamil | [[Gandhi Krishna]] | [[Udayaraj]], Dinesh, Ranjani, [[Roja Selvamani|Roja]] |Daughter of a film actress befriends two boys who work in a mechanic shop. | |- ! scope="row" |''[[Little John (film)|Little John]]'' | 2001 | English, Hindi, Tamil | [[Singeetam Srinivasa Rao]] | [[Bentley Mitchum]], [[Jyothika]], [[Anupam Kher]] |A foreigner who arrives to India to do a research on Mookuthi Amman temple is accused of stealing ring of the goddess. | {{cite news|url=https://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-miscellaneous/tp-others/film-review-little-john/article27928122.ece|title=Film review: ''Little John'' – OTHERS|website=The Hindu|date=12 April 2001 |accessdate=2019-09-18}} |- ! scope="row" |''[[Krishna Krishna]]'' | 2001 | Tamil | [[S. Ve. Shekher]] | [[S. Ve. Shekher]], [[Sukanya (actress)|Sukanya]], [[Sriman (actor)|Sriman]] |Gopalakrishnan faces problems after his wife suspects and mistakes him for everything. | |- ! scope="row" |''[[Pandavar Bhoomi]]'' | 2001 | Tamil | [[Cheran (director)|Cheran]] | [[Arun Vijay]], Shamitha, [[Rajkiran]], [[Ranjith (actor)|Ranjith]] |Dhanasekar hires an engineer, to rebuild his ancestral house. When he falls in love with Dhanasekar's niece, Dhanasekar narrates his family's past, which changes his mind to sacrifice his love. | |- ! scope="row" |''[[Pammal K. Sambandam]]'' | 2002 | Tamil | [[T. S. B. K. Moulee|Moulee]] | [[Kamal Haasan]], [[Simran (actress)|Simran]], [[Abbas (actor)|Abbas]], [[Sneha (actress)|Sneha]] |A stuntman who works in film industry and a female doctor both hate the word "Love". | {{cite web|url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/2002/feb/15pammal.htm|website=rediff.com|title=rediff.com, Movies: The review of Pammal K Sambandham|accessdate=2019-09-18}} |- ! scope="row" |''[[Whistle (2003 film)|Whistle]]'' | 2003 | Tamil | [[J. D.- Jerry]] | [[Vikramaditya Shukla|Vikramaditya]], [[Sherin]], [[Gayathri Raguram]] |Sarawathi, a young girl, commits suicide after being bullied by Anjali and her friends. Years later, when her friends start turning up dead, she fears that Sarawathi has returned to exact revenge. | {{cite news|url=https://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-features/tp-fridayreview/whistle/article28573524.ece|title="Whistle" – CHEN|website=The Hindu|accessdate=2019-09-18}} |} ;Films as distributor In addition to the films produced by Media Dreams, the following films from other banners were distributed by the company. *''[[12B]]'' (2001) *''[[Asoka (2001 film)|Samrat Ashoka]]'' (2001; dubbed) ;Television * ''Balu Mahendra Kathai Neram'' * ''Ladies Club – "Senior / Junior"'' * ''Southern Spice'' * ''Neelavaanam'' * ''Thozhigal'' * ''Thanthira Bhoomi'' * ''Ambighai'' == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Film distributors of India]] [[Category:Film production companies based in Chennai]] [[Category:Indian film studios]] [[Category:1997 establishments in Tamil Nadu]] [[Category:Indian companies established in 1997]] [[Category:Mass media companies established in 1997]]
contentMetadata.text: Media Dreams was an Indian film production and distribution company formed in 1997. It produced several Tamil language films in the early 2000s, and was later acquired by Pentamedia Graphics. Media Dreams was set up in 1997 as an Indian entertainment business unit catering to the television, theatre and the internet. It was acquired by Pentamedia Graphics in December 2000. The group's key partners included prominent writer Sujatha as its managing director. The studio's first feature film Bharathi, a biopic of poet Subramania Bharati, opened to critical and commercial acclaim, prompting the producers to take on several more projects in the early 2000s. Other notable films that the group made during the period included Cheran's family drama Pandavar Bhoomi (2001), Singeetam Srinivasa Rao's multilingual fantasy film Little John (2001) and Moulee's comedy drama Pammal K. Sambandam (2002) starring Kamal Haasan. The group also subsequently moved onto distribute films, make television serials such as Balu Mahendra's Kadhai Neram, and release audio albums. In early 2001, Media Dreams announced that they would produce Robo, a science fiction film by Shankar, starring Kamal Haasan and Preity Zinta. However, the film was later stalled due to escalating costs. The team had also announced that they would produce the film version of Sundara Ramaswamy's novel Oru Puliyamarathin Kathai, which would mark the directorial debut of art director P. Krishnamoorthy, but the project eventually did not materialise. The commercial failure of some of its films forced the group to stop making films, with its final release Whistle (2003), having a delayed release. Films as producer Films as distributor In addition to the films produced by Media Dreams, the following films from other banners were distributed by the company. 12B (2001) Samrat Ashoka (2001; dubbed) Television Balu Mahendra Kathai Neram Ladies Club – "Senior / Junior" Southern Spice Neelavaanam Thozhigal Thanthira Bhoomi Ambighai "Media Dreams Ltd. – Fullfilling your Entertainment Dreams..." Jyotika stars in English movie". m.rediff.com. Retrieved 18 September 2019. HostOnNet.com. "BizHat.com – Pandavar Bhoomi Review. Arunkumar, Shamitha, Rajkiran, Ranjith, Manorama". movies.bizhat.com. Retrieved 18 September 2019. "rediff.com, Movies: No kiss for this miss". rediff.com. Retrieved 18 September 2019. "KBC in Tamil!". rediff.com. 16 September 2000. Retrieved 14 July 2020. "Kadal Pookal for Tamil new years day  Bharathiraja". cinematoday2.itgo.com. Retrieved 18 September 2019. "'Hamsa Geethe' to 'Bharathi': Meet Krishnamoorthy, the designer behind iconic film sets". The News Minute. 22 February 2018. Retrieved 18 September 2019. "Chinna". cinematoday2.itgo.com. Retrieved 18 September 2019. "rediff.com, Movies: The Rediff Review: Tamil film Bharati". rediff.com. tableData: The film is a biography of renowned Tamil poet Subramaniya Bharathi.
Daughter of a film actress befriends two boys who work in a mechanic shop.
A foreigner who arrives to India to do a research on Mookuthi Amman temple is accused of stealing ring of the goddess.
Gopalakrishnan faces problems after his wife suspects and mistakes him for everything.
Dhanasekar hires an engineer, to rebuild his ancestral house. When he falls in love with Dhanasekar's niece, Dhanasekar narrates his family's past, which changes his mind to sacrifice his love.
A stuntman who works in film industry and a female doctor both hate the word "Love".
Sarawathi, a young girl, commits suicide after being bullied by Anjali and her friends. Years later, when her friends start turning up dead, she fears that Sarawathi has returned to exact revenge.

texts.title: History
texts.value:
Media Dreams was set up in 1997 as an Indian entertainment business unit catering to the television, theatre and the internet. It was acquired by [[Pentamedia Graphics]] in December 2000.<ref name="rediff">{{cite web|url=https://www.rediff.com/money/2000/dec/26risc.htm|title=rediff.com: Money – RISC Corporate Announcements|website=rediff.com|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref><ref name="rediff2">{{cite web|url=https://www.rediff.com/money/2004/aug/16maya.htm|website=rediff.com|title=Mayajaal shares may be listed soon|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref><ref name="oocities">{{cite web|url=http://www.oocities.org/sujathapage/english/enews.html|website=oocities.org|title=sujathapage/english/enews|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref> The group's key partners included prominent writer [[Sujatha (writer)|Sujatha]] as its managing director.<ref name="mudhra">{{cite web|url=https://www.mudhra.org/monthly-2001.html|title=Mudhra Monthly Programmes – 2001|website=Mudhra|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref>

The studio's first feature film [[Bharathi (2000 film)|Bharathi]], a biopic of poet [[Subramania Bharati]], opened to critical and commercial acclaim, prompting the producers to take on several more projects in the early 2000s.<ref name="sify">{{cite web|url=https://www.sify.com/movies/bharathi-review-tamil-pcluaKbagdjjd.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220225071400/https://www.sify.com/movies/bharathi-review-tamil-pcluaKbagdjjd.html|url-status=dead|archive-date=25 February 2022|website=[[Sify]]|title=Review : (2001)|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref><ref name="geocities">{{cite web|url=http://www.geocities.ws/gokima/may2001.html|website=geocities.ws|title=Gokul's Tamil Cinema News|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref> Other notable films that the group made during the period included [[Cheran (director)|Cheran]]'s family drama [[Pandavar Bhoomi]] (2001), [[Singeetam Srinivasa Rao]]'s multilingual fantasy film [[Little John (film)|Little John]] (2001) and [[Moulee]]'s comedy drama [[Pammal K. Sambandam]] (2002) starring [[Kamal Haasan]].<ref name="rediff3">{{cite web|url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/2001/apr/07kamal.htm|website=rediff.com|title=rediff.com, Movies: Showbuzz! Kamal fighting fit!|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref><ref name="rediff4">{{cite web|url=https://m.rediff.com/movies/2000/sep/02eng.htm|website=m.rediff.com|title=rediff.com, Movies: Showbuzz! Jyotika stars in English movie|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref><ref name="bizhat">{{cite web|url=http://movies.bizhat.com/review_pandavar_bhoomi.php|author=HostOnNet.com|title=BizHat.com – Pandavar Bhoomi Review. Arunkumar, Shamitha, Rajkiran, Ranjith, Manorama|website=movies.bizhat.com|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref><ref name="rediff5">{{cite web|url=https://www.rediff.com/entertai/2000/aug/04ss.htm|website=rediff.com|title=rediff.com, Movies: No kiss for this miss|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref> The group also subsequently moved onto distribute films, make television serials such as [[Balu Mahendra]]'s Kadhai Neram, and release audio albums.<ref name="rediff6">{{cite news|url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/2000/sep/16tt.htm|website=rediff.com|title=KBC in Tamil!|date=16 September 2000|accessdate=14 July 2020}}</ref>

In early 2001, Media Dreams announced that they would produce [[Enthiran|Robo]], a science fiction film by [[S. Shankar|Shankar]], starring [[Kamal Haasan]] and [[Preity Zinta]]. However, the film was later stalled due to escalating costs.<ref name="itgo">{{cite web|url=http://cinematoday2.itgo.com/Tamil%20Movie%20News23.htm|website=cinematoday2.itgo.com|title=Kadal Pookal for Tamil new years day  Bharathiraja|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref> The team had also announced that they would produce the film version of [[Sundara Ramaswamy]]'s novel Oru Puliyamarathin Kathai, which would mark the directorial debut of art director [[P. Krishnamoorthy]], but the project eventually did not materialise.<ref name="thenewsminute">{{cite web|url=https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/hamsa-geethe-bharathi-meet-krishnamoorthy-designer-behind-iconic-film-sets-76854|title='Hamsa Geethe' to 'Bharathi': Meet Krishnamoorthy, the designer behind iconic film sets|website=The News Minute|date=22 February 2018 |accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref> The commercial failure of some of its films forced the group to stop making films, with its final release [[Whistle (2003 film)|Whistle]] (2003), having a delayed release.<ref name="itgo2">{{cite web|url=http://cinematoday2.itgo.com/h_com%20-%2016052001.htm|website=cinematoday2.itgo.com|title=Chinna|accessdate=2019-09-18}}</ref>

Daughter of a film actress befriends two boys who work in a mechanic shop.
A foreigner who arrives to India to do a research on Mookuthi Amman temple is accused of stealing ring of the goddess.
Gopalakrishnan faces problems after his wife suspects and mistakes him for everything.
Dhanasekar hires an engineer, to rebuild his ancestral house. When he falls in love with Dhanasekar's niece, Dhanasekar narrates his family's past, which changes his mind to sacrifice his love.
A stuntman who works in film industry and a female doctor both hate the word "Love".
Sarawathi, a young girl, commits suicide after being bullied by Anjali and her friends. Years later, when her friends start turning up dead, she fears that Sarawathi has returned to exact revenge.

annotation.label: original language of film or TV show
